questions.text: The likely size of the uterus at 8 weeks postpartum is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

100 gm Weight of uterus: Immediately after delivery – 1000 gm

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: B. At the end of 1 week – 500 gm Option: C. At the end of 2 weeks – 300 gm Option: D. At the end of 6 weeks it weighs – 60 gm (Pre-pregnant state).

questions.text: The following statement is true for the internal rotation of the head:

options.label: A
options.text: Rotation occurs mostly in the cervix

options.label: B
options.text: In the majority rotation occurs in the pelvic floor

options.label: C
options.text: Rotation occurs commonly after the crowning of the head

options.label: D
options.text: Rotation is earlier in primipara than multipara

questions.correct_answer: B. In the majority rotation occurs in the pelvic floor
questions.explanation:
Solution:

In the majority rotation occurs in the pelvic floor In the majority, rotation occurs in the pelvic floor . The prerequisites of anterior internal rotation of the head are a well-flexed head , efficient uterine contraction , favourable shape at the mid-pelvic plane and tone of the levator ani muscles The level at which internal rotation occurs is variable .

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Rotation in the cervix although favorable occurs less frequently . In the majority of cases, rotation occurs at the pelvic floor . Option: D. Internal rotation occurs earlier in multipara than in primipara Option: C. Rarely , it occurs as late as the crowning of the head.
